verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Hew<WH6458> thee two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68> like unto the first<WH7223>: and I will write<WH3789> upon these tables<WH3871> the words<WH1697> that were in the first<WH7223> tables<WH3871>, which thou brakest<WH7665>.

And be ready<WH3559> in the morning<WH1242>, and come up<WH5927> in the morning<WH1242> unto mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>, and present<WH5324> thyself there to me in the top<WH7218> of the mount<WH2022>.

And no man<WH376> shall come up<WH5927> with thee, neither<WH408> let any man<WH376> be seen<WH7200> throughout all the mount<WH2022>; neither let the flocks<WH6629> nor herds<WH1241> feed<WH7462> before<WH4136> that mount<WH2022>.

And he hewed<WH6458> two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68> like unto the first<WH7223>; and Moses<WH4872> rose up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and went up<WH5927> unto mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>, as the LORD<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> him, and took<WH3947> in his hand<WH3027> the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68>.
And the LORD<WH3068> descended<WH3381> in the cloud<WH6051>, and stood<WH3320> with him there, and proclaimed<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>.

And the LORD<WH3068> passed by<WH5674> before him<WH6440>, and proclaimed<WH7121>, The LORD<WH3068>, The LORD<WH3068> God<WH410>, merciful<WH7349> and gracious<WH2587>, longsuffering<WH750> <WH639>, and abundant<WH7227> in goodness<WH2617> and truth<WH571>,

Keeping<WH5341> mercy<WH2617> for thousands<WH505>, forgiving<WH5375> iniquity<WH5771> and transgression<WH6588> and sin<WH2403>, and that will by no means<WH5352> clear<WH5352> the guilty; visiting<WH6485> the iniquity<WH5771> of the fathers<WH1> upon the children<WH1121>, and upon the children's<WH1121> children, unto the third<WH8029> and to the fourth<WH7256> generation.
And Moses<WH4872> made haste<WH4116>, and bowed his head<WH6915> toward the earth<WH776>, and worshipped<WH7812>.

And he said<WH559>, If now I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, O Lord<WH136>, let my Lord<WH136>, I pray thee, go<WH3212> among<WH7130> us; for it is a stiffnecked<WH7186> <WH6203> people<WH5971>; and pardon<WH5545> our iniquity<WH5771> and our sin<WH2403>, and take us for thine inheritance<WH5157>.

And he said<WH559>, Behold, I make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285>: before all thy people<WH5971> I will do<WH6213> marvels<WH6381>, such as have not been done<WH1254> in all the earth<WH776>, nor in any nation<WH1471>: and all the people<WH5971> among<WH7130> which thou art shall see<WH7200> the work<WH4639> of the LORD<WH3068>: for it is a terrible thing<WH3372> that I will do<WH6213> with thee.

Observe<WH8104> thou that which I command<WH6680> thee this day<WH3117>: behold, I drive out<WH1644> before<WH6440> thee the Amorite<WH567>, and the Canaanite<WH3669>, and the Hittite<WH2850>, and the Perizzite<WH6522>, and the Hivite<WH2340>, and the Jebusite<WH2983>.

Take heed<WH8104> to thyself, lest thou make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> whither thou goest<WH935>, lest it be for a snare<WH4170> in the midst<WH7130> of thee:
But ye shall destroy<WH5422> their altars<WH4196>, break<WH7665> their images<WH4676>, and cut down<WH3772> their groves<WH842>: images: Heb. statues
For thou shalt worship<WH7812> no other<WH312> god<WH410>: for the LORD<WH3068>, whose name<WH8034> is Jealous<WH7067>, is a jealous<WH7067> God<WH410>:

Lest thou make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776>, and they go a whoring<WH2181> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>, and do sacrifice<WH2076> unto their gods<WH430>, and one call<WH7121> thee, and thou eat<WH398> of his sacrifice<WH2077>;

And thou take<WH3947> of their daughters<WH1323> unto thy sons<WH1121>, and their daughters<WH1323> go a whoring<WH2181> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>, and make<WH2181> thy sons<WH1121> go a whoring<WH2181> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>.
Thou shalt make<WH6213> thee no molten<WH4541> gods<WH430>.

The feast<WH2282> of unleavened bread<WH4682> shalt thou keep<WH8104>. Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> thou shalt eat<WH398> unleavened bread<WH4682>, as I commanded<WH6680> thee, in the time<WH4150> of the month<WH2320> Abib<WH24>: for in the month<WH2320> Abib<WH24> thou camest out<WH3318> from Egypt<WH4714>.
All that openeth<WH6363> the matrix<WH7358> is mine; and every firstling<WH6363> among thy cattle<WH4735>, whether ox<WH7794> or sheep<WH7716>, that is male<WH2142>. sheep: or, kid

But the firstling<WH6363> of an ass<WH2543> thou shalt redeem<WH6299> with a lamb<WH7716>: and if thou redeem<WH6299> him not, then shalt thou break his neck<WH6202>. All the firstborn<WH1060> of thy sons<WH1121> thou shalt redeem<WH6299>. And none shall appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> me empty<WH7387>. lamb: or, kid
Six<WH8337> days<WH3117> thou shalt work<WH5647>, but on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> thou shalt rest<WH7673>: in earing time<WH2758> and in harvest<WH7105> thou shalt rest<WH7673>.

And thou shalt observe<WH6213> the feast<WH2282> of weeks<WH7620>, of the firstfruits<WH1061> of wheat<WH2406> harvest<WH7105>, and the feast<WH2282> of ingathering<WH614> at the year's<WH8141> end<WH8622>. year's end: Heb. revolution of the year
Thrice<WH6471> <WH7969> in the year<WH8141> shall all your men children<WH2138> appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH113> GOD<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

For I will cast out<WH3423> the nations<WH1471> before<WH6440> thee, and enlarge<WH7337> thy borders<WH1366>: neither shall any man<WH376> desire<WH2530> thy land<WH776>, when thou shalt go up<WH5927> to appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> thrice<WH6471> <WH7969> in the year<WH8141>.

Thou shalt not offer<WH7819> the blood<WH1818> of my sacrifice<WH2077> with leaven<WH2557>; neither shall the sacrifice<WH2077> of the feast<WH2282> of the passover<WH6453> be left<WH3885> unto the morning<WH1242>.

The first<WH7225> of the firstfruits<WH1061> of thy land<WH127> thou shalt bring<WH935> unto the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>. Thou shalt not seethe<WH1310> a kid<WH1423> in his mother's<WH517> milk<WH2461>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Write<WH3789> thou these words<WH1697>: for after the tenor<WH6310> of these words<WH1697> I have made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with thee and with Israel<WH3478>.

And he was there with the LORD<WH3068> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>; he did neither eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>, nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>. And he wrote<WH3789> upon the tables<WH3871> the words<WH1697> of the covenant<WH1285>, the ten<WH6235> commandments<WH1697>. commandments: Heb. words

And it came to pass, when Moses<WH4872> came down<WH3381> from mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514> with the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of testimony<WH5715> in Moses'<WH4872> hand<WH3027>, when he came down<WH3381> from the mount<WH2022>, that Moses<WH4872> wist<WH3045> not that the skin<WH5785> of his face<WH6440> shone<WH7160> while he talked<WH1696> with him.

And when Aaron<WH175> and all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> Moses<WH4872>, behold, the skin<WH5785> of his face<WH6440> shone<WH7160>; and they were afraid<WH3372> to come nigh<WH5066> him.
And Moses<WH4872> called<WH7121> unto them; and Aaron<WH175> and all the rulers<WH5387> of the congregation<WH5712> returned<WH7725> unto him: and Moses<WH4872> talked<WH1696> with them.

And afterward<WH310> all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came nigh<WH5066>: and he gave them in commandment<WH6680> all that the LORD<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> with him in mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>.
And till Moses<WH4872> had done<WH3615> speaking<WH1696> with them, he put<WH5414> a vail<WH4533> on his face<WH6440>.

But when Moses<WH4872> went in<WH935> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> to speak<WH1696> with him, he took<WH5493> the vail<WH4533> off<WH5493>, until he came out<WH3318>. And he came out<WH3318>, and spake<WH1696> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> that which he was commanded<WH6680>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> the face<WH6440> of Moses<WH4872>, that the skin<WH5785> of Moses'<WH4872> face<WH6440> shone<WH7160>: and Moses<WH4872> put<WH7725> the vail<WH4533> upon his face<WH6440> again<WH7725>, until he went<WH935> in to speak<WH1696> with him.
